website_summaries.verdict: A comfortable knife with a very durable blade. Great for those who seek quality on a budget.
cons: Some say the blade needs frequent sharpening
It's best if a professional does this job

customer_reviews.title: Good steel, but odd angle of handle to blade makes it sit wrong in my hand
customer_reviews.text: Stays sharp and hones with a steel very well. It's now my primary go-to knife in the kitchen until I find a better replacement. The bad thing about it is that the handle angles up toward the end which makes the blade sit tip-up in your hand. For me, at least, this is not a comfortable nor normal position for any use. It took a bit of getting used to and now I can use it safely, but this is the first knife I've used that when first using it, I accidentally stabbed my hand, requiring stitches. If you get one, please be cautious.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Dull As Can Be
customer_reviews.text: After seeing America’s Test Kitchen rave about this knife and the awesome reviews here on Amazon, I expected an amazingly sharp knife. What I received is a dull, clunky knife. Into the bottom drawer it went. I’ll stick to my old dull knives, which are sharper than this new knife. Something must have changed in their manufacturing process. I’d like to see ATK re-evaluate this knife, because it’s absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on various websites before ordering this knife and thought I had made a sound choice. I was disappointed to find that it did not come close to matching the recommendations. It was not particularly sharp, and it was not comfortable in my hand. My membership-club knives perform much better, and they’re cheap enough that I’m willing to sharpen them myself with a basic electric sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: WHW

customer_reviews.title: Missed quality control, sharp handle edge.
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this knife after reading rave reviews and getting advice from a friend who is a local chef. The blade itself seems good, but where the blade meets the handle, the plastic material looks to have been misformed. It creates a sharp edge right where I grip. I am returning this and ordered a replacement. We'll see if that one is better. Maybe I got the 1 out of 1000 that missed quality control. I attached 2 pictures, one of the "bad side" and one of the "good". The bad is blade down, good is blade up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for an inexpensive knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife got the Cook's Illustrated rating for best chef's knife for the price. I guess so. Brand new, it cuts as well as my 30 year old, very used German knives. I don't care much for the handle (a little too big for my hand) and the weight (blade is thin and there's not much heft to the knife) but it works ok. It will work as a good back up so I have a knife when the good ones go in for sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: DogsRunMyLife

customer_reviews.title: PSA do not use to smash garlic
customer_reviews.text: Love this knife for cutting vegetables and fruit! But the blade is too thin/flimsy and is hard to control when smashing garlic. Recently got a nasty cut on my palm and want to warn others
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at all...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much of a waste of money. $1 Ikea knives are far superior in quality. I got the first knife and within 2 weeks, th3 blade started chipping at places. I contacted Amazon customer service and received a replacement. It's the same story with this one too.
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: My favorite knife!
customer_reviews.text: If you cook at all you know that using comfortable and sharp knife makes all the difference in the world. I find myself not having to sharpen this knife as often as I sharpen my far more expensive knives. Also the handle from which you hold it from fits perfect in my hand making it more comfortable when cutting slicing chopping or whatever. It has quickly become my most favorite knife to use inspite of my more expensive knive that I own. I look forward to the many more meals I'll be using this knife to assist!
customer_reviews.author: Olga S.

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: We have had this knife for years and its held up very well. It is fairly sharp and good for general use like cutting vegetables and fruits. However, it is not my go-to knife for cutting onions. Its just not that sharp and it will lead to more onion juice squishing out and more tears. We have much sharper knives that cut onions with a lot less tears. But, those very sharp knives will really hurt us if we slip and they cost a lot more. So, as usual you get what you pay for--but you cant go wrong with this as ageneral purpose knife thats long-lasting and fairy good.
customer_reviews.author: pnlop1

customer_reviews.title: First Impression
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I like this knife. There's no mistaking the edge for some of the fancy supersteel knives coming out of Japan, but it came with a nice edge; slicing onions was tear-free and fast. The handle feels nice, but a bit "squishier" than I was expecting. This isn't a complaint, as it seems to still wash up well. There are some features that I like better than my Henckels 4*, especially the rounded edges on the top of the blade and the slightly taller blade. Overall, I'm quite happy with the purchase, especially at less than $30.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday gift for my Father-in-law and after a week of use, the cutting part of the knife started to chip away, as you can see in the pictures. He was very disappointed and I felt sorely embarrassed after I chose this knife over another knife he actually asked for, due to the positive reviews on this knife. I expected much better from a knife with this brand name. Will not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio A

customer_reviews.title: Bad Reviews??? See video
customer_reviews.text: Attached is a quick video if you want to see exactly how sharp this knife is. Just got it 2 days ago. Also, from reading the negative reviews, they are mostly due to knife dullness....YOU NEED TO SHARPEN THEM....just like anyone in a professional kitchen will tell you. Anyway, the knife is awsome and is extremely comfortable in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox makes quality knives.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother-in-law after her favorite knife was accidentally(allegedly) thrown out by father-in-law. As is customary to our culture, I sold it to her for $0.01. This is the 3rd Victorinox knife that I have bought. Their knives hold an edge very well. The previous 2 knives that I bought have been deep sea fishing with me a couple times and have no signs of corrosion from the salt water. Quality knives for an unbeatable price. All the knives say "Swiss Made" on them. I can't verify this but i dont question it based on the quality.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first “good” knife that I’ve ever owned. I researched it online and America’s Test Kitchen and other resources highly recommended the Victorinox. I can even cut tiny cherry tomatoes without them squishing our everywhere. Makes cooking prep a lot more pleasurable. I was initially a little scared owning such a sharp knife but so far so good, it’s sharp enough it doesn’t slip when chopping. I haven’t had to sharpen it yet but it looks like it will sharpen nicely. Check out YouTube reviews of this knife. They will inspire!
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Go to kitchen workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I have many other more expensive knives, but when I am at work I find myself reaching for this knife. The fibrox handle is fantastically ergonomic amd slip proof, the weight and heft of the blade are nice and light. The blade is almost indestructible, I loaned it to a FNG, who knicked the heck out of the blade, I was able to fix it on a stone in 30 mins. Has a nice rock to it, and can shred butternut squash and break down chickens. I recommend this knife to anybody entering the industry, and also to home chefs looking for an inexpensive yet profoundly viable workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to sharpen, easy to maneuver, easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Victronox chef knife. No, my first one is still giving good service, it's just that when I moved in with my sister, she took over my knife because it was so easy for her to use! So I had to get another one so I could have a knife of my own! My sister has some hysicalk limitations that make cutting difficult so I really couldn't take it away from her. Easy to clean and keep sharp. I got the paring knife since this brand was so good. I've paid double the amount and not gotten as comfortable service. Thanks for this great knife!
customer_reviews.author: Phancy

customer_reviews.title: very sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This knife was recommended by ATK. They are seldom wrong and this knife is the best I have ever used. It was so light weight I was skeptical if it would perform as well as my much more pricey knives. The 8" chefs knife and 5" paring knife are a dream to use and I must be very careful cleaning them due to the incredible sharpness. Now I understand how the ATK chefs slice and dice so cleanly and easily. (Ripe Tomatoes as thin as paper). When sharpening is needed it takes only a few swipes with a honing steel or an electric sharpener to restore the edge. Do try this brand of knives.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra  Short

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but quickly dulls
customer_reviews.text: Decent knife for the price (when they have a deal), but it dulls very quickly. I used to be able to cut anything with this when I first got it, but has gotten too dull for a lot of things now. I always sharpen my knifes, and it does help for a short time. It seems that if I want to enjoy this knife, I would need to sharpen it each and every time. I am going to need to upgrade to a real quality knife soon.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp -- nice rubber handle -- affordable price to get a decent knife
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a friend for their housewarming after going over to their house and being forced to cut chicken cutlets with a steak knife.... YUCK. I read the wirecutter review for this knife which stated that it didn't arrive sharp enough to slice through paper so I was a little hesitant. When it arrived at the office we pulled it out and I have to say that it cut through paper like it was butter. Sheet after sheet with no tearing. Not sure how long it will keep its edge, but it certainly was very impressive out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R

customer_reviews.title: Do you need to sharpen it out of the box?
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product for an everyday chef's knife and after a few days (and even out of the box) we were concerned about the sharpness. Based on reviews everyone loved it but I'm not sure if we are doing something wrong. Does it need a first time initial sharpen?
customer_reviews.author: Karen Warner

customer_reviews.title: Knife arrived dull.
customer_reviews.text: The knife I received came full—as in did not have an edge at all. Highly disappointing. I did sharpen the knife with a lansky sharpening set and now the knife works great. I expect a “quality” knife to arrive with at least some sort of an edge on it
customer_reviews.author: jcmiller

customer_reviews.title: Sharp knife.  Wish the plastic handle were shaped differently at the blade
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife for the money. Should have bought one years ago. My only complaint is that the plastic handle cover is not vertical at the bolster. It's slanted at an angle towards the blade's spine. This means that when you try to insert the knife in a normal butcher block or try to slide the knife into a normal edge protector, this slanted piece of plastic prevents the knife from being inserted fully. So you're left with a couple inches of razor-sharp knife sticking out of the block. That ought to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Balanced sharp knife
customer_reviews.text: Never knew how much of a difference a good knife makes in the kitchen. Bought this after I started cooking more and this knife makes chopping up meat and vegetables super easy. It feels very balanced in the hand and makes cutting things easy. I’ve had it for over a year now and it has maintained its sharpness. One of the best purchases I have made and has made cooking enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very good knife for the price. It is light weight and easy to handle. The blade is remarkably thin and does an amazing job. I have only had it a week or so but am using it more than my other knives already. I am hoping it does not dull quickly which is a problem I’ve had of late being in the kitchen more and not being able to get it knives professionally sharpened. Overall, quite satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ABJ

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: I got the 8" Chefs knife. This thing is freakin huge - I didn't expect that. It's also sharp as all get out. If you do lots of chopping on veggies, meat, or whatever - this knife is perfect for you. My smaller cheap chefs knife that I regularly sharpen doesn't hold a candle to this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Light, simple
customer_reviews.text: Got this as gift for my boyfriend, he said he liked it right off the bat, it’s a simple kitchen knife but it seemed quality. Unknown how well the knife has aged since I dumped him soon after that.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Combs

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Performance & Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to use while she works out of town as a functional but reasonably priced "do it all" kitchen knife. It certainly meets that need. I personally use a high priced professional German chef's knife, as well as a professional Japanese knife. The Victorinox is not as sharp as the Japanese, or as well balanced as the German, but it is 80% as good as either at about 30% of the cost. The textured handle provides a good safe grip. I do wish they would provide a protective sheath for the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Cut Through Meat or Even Melons like a Profressinal. Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this knife as a replacement for my chef-knife set at Walmart. And out of the package, you can see the difference. The blade is a perfect size for my big hands and the grip has some sort of slip resistant which you can hold it more firmly. Indeed, I would say since the bland is kind of unique and soft (smooth,) an included bland sharpener will be more welcome to ensure Customers have the best quality experience while building trust for us to become consistent customers!!!! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I finally have a sharp knife for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited this long to buy a decent, everyday knife. I could kick myself. Yes, this is sharp. Be careful. No, I have yet to cut myself. It is merely a matter of time, I know that. I am able to cut items in a way that I only dreamed I could cut in the past. Green onions cut up finely... without effort. Sliced white onion moons... consistent, thin slices. I never thought that would be possible. I can power through a pile of cilantro in a heartbeat. Wow. Just love this knife.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for my elderly parents. All of thier knives were terribly dull. On our last visit, I used the knife to chop tomatoes. I was shocked at how dull the blade was! Save your money for a decent knife. This blade is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: CDUB

customer_reviews.title: We had a good chef's knife, this is better
customer_reviews.text: We ha a perfectly acceptable chef's knife, but America's Test Kitchen was so enamored of this knife that we bought one. And we don't regret it. It's light, rigid, smooth, and has plenty of room under the handle for my giant fingers. And it's really sharp. We are now buying them as gifts for kids and cousins and other people starting their kitchens. The first thing you need is a knife, and this is the one to get. Actually, maybe the first thing you need is a good skillet, but this is no lower than second. You couldn't ask for a better knife.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A Walters

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Weighted, Holds a Razor Edge
customer_reviews.text: I have had this knife for 3 months now and although it is not as sharp as the day I got it I still give it lots of respect as it has held an edge very well. I have owned other high end knives that cost much more than this (J.A. Henckels, Wustof, Zwilling) this is by far my go to knife in the kitchen now. I was worried about the plastic handle but that has turned out to be an advantage over my previous wood handled knives. The one draw back is that the sides are no hollow ground so food tends to stick to the knife pretty tenaciously. I highly recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Really like the feel
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife because it's thin and lightweight in comparison to some other knives I have. I've used it for about a year and it seems to retain it's edge quite well since I haven't had to sharpen it yet. I also put this in the dishwasher and it hasn't shown signs of rust (maybe a little spot or two that comes right off with some soap). Would recommend if you're looking for a reasonably priced and sturdy knife.
customer_reviews.author: Edward K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Knife at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: My existing knives are from the stone age (See what I did there? Huh, huh?!). I bought this knife after reading its reviews and it's been a great purchase. The knife is easy to hold and it's extremely sharp. The knife is so good I'm going to have to learn how to sharpen knives...oy.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best knife - Makes food prep a joy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this knife for my mom because I love my Victorinox so much. It's comfortable to hold while cutting and chopping. The handle is a textured plastic which makes it easy to hold and use even when your hands are wet. The blade stays sharp. I hone it on my Cuisine Art knife sharpener and it comes out beautifully sharp every time. I purchased this knife at the recommendation of Americas Test Kitchen / Cooks Country and agree with their review. This knife makes food prep a joy.
customer_reviews.author: Nakima

customer_reviews.title: Gets dull quickly
customer_reviews.text: Everything all well; Worst part: got dull in a few weeks! What do you expect from a knife??!
customer_reviews.author: Siavash Soleymani

customer_reviews.title: Very Sharp but lighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife. I do all the cooking, everyday and entertaining and rely on my knives to hold an edge and they get a lot of use. I hone regularly with a rod and never have needed to use a sharpener. I have had it now for about a year...I am used to a weightier knife so this requires a bit more hand pressure but the edge has not let me down. At this price, buy two!! Actually you could buy 5 for the price of a Henkels or Wusstof.
customer_reviews.author: H. H. Mandly

customer_reviews.title: Durable chef's knife!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months now and wanted to leave my feedback on this after some time. This knife is really well built for it's price. The handle is easy to maneuver and the sharpness hold for a pretty long time on this knife. I wish the factory blade was better sharpened as it was only sharp in the middle but the top 1/3 of the knife were noticeability less sharp than the center and aft portion of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Rush

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for the price! Its extremely sharp and with a good shape. I love it and use it everyday since it arrived. I am not a professional cook, and it makes me feel like one! Only recommendation is... be extremely careful when using it (always cut away from your fingers), because since its so sharp its easy to cut yourself by accident (it happened to me when taking skin out of a chicken). Would buy it again or a 2nd!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by America’s Test Kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had a good knife. This is the one America’s Test Kitchen uses. Well I know why now! What a fantastic knife!!! I can’t believe how easy things are to cut now. Only problem is, I’ve gotten a few cuts because this thing is SHARP. It’s easy to hold and a nice size. I breeze through onions or whatever I’m cutting easier than I ever knew possible. I’m thrilled ever time I need to chop veggies. No kidding, I feel like a chop ninja. What a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: KansasKat.

customer_reviews.title: yeah it's a fine knife
customer_reviews.text: after geeking out about knives for a couple of years I didn't want to believe in the reviews of the victorianox beater knives as being so good. I've tried the dalstrong, zhen and shun lines and I like them. But something about the right thinness of 8" and the 6" and the type of steal / finish this knife has, that I love them. They don't bring the ogle due to their plastic handles and simple polish blade, but man are they great to use! Love them in my line up.
customer_reviews.author: Regi

customer_reviews.title: Beaware
customer_reviews.text: Beware this is a counterfeit. Horrible quality. Got dull after 3 weeks of use. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: haseeb Ferozan

customer_reviews.title: best knife i've used in the kitchen in some time...
customer_reviews.text: arguably one of the best chef's knives i've ever bought and used with any length of time. it was sharp, stays sharp, and holds an edge when sharpened. the balance is great and you can choke up on it should you need. i've owned knives that ranged from $300 for hand forged customs to stuff off the shelf at a dime store, and this is the very best value knife i've ever used with any length of time. buy without hesitation. i have both the 10" and the 8"... i prefer the 10" for larger quantities, but my daughter is 8yr old and uses this one much more easily considering the length.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: This knife is designed for the use and abuse user - kitchen prep might love it. For me
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the sharpest knives I've encountered out of the package. If you buy your knives from a Walmart of a Target this knife will put their sharpness to shame. For a similar price, I would say this knife out-performs most of what you'll find in a chain-retail store. This knife is designed for the use and abuse user - kitchen prep might love it. For me, it was too industrial for home use - comfortablitliy and sharpness did not make up for its commercial-cut 10,000 potatoes because I have to- marketing. If you want a sharp knife that holds its edge and makes you please to show it to your guests, look a bit further.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: The best knife for your money
customer_reviews.text: I have handled a lot of chef's knives, and since I heard this one was $40 I haven't stopped recommending it. It's better than a mediocre carbon steel, it's better than expensive german steel, and it's better than fancy-pattern japanese steel. The handle leaves something to be desired, but the price is unbeatable. It cuts paper thin tomato slices and crushes garlic with ease. Slightly more flexible than a japanese knife, but the edge is far better than any Shun I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Buy a higher quality knife
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in how lightweight this is. Expected more from Victorinox. Do yourself a favor and purchase a high-end chef’s knife. Mind you, this knife is fine for cutting tomatoes, but a higher quality knife will make life in the kitchen more pleasurable. It requires constant sharpening, but I don’t mind that.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife, but the handle isn't very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this knife for over a year and it works well but I would recommend getting a knife with a heavier handle. I would recommend the "Mercer Culinary Genesis Forged Chef's Knife, 8 Inch" because it overall feels a lot nicer and looks a lot nicer. I was recommended this knife by a butcher and it definitely was worth it but I wish I had the Mercer knife that I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Big yet great (7.9-Inch)
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how big the 7.9-Inch one is. When it came, I was almost going to return it. But then COVID hit and it's a pain to go out of the house. So I kept it. It is so sharp that it cut a hole in my bedding when I was trying to get it out of the box (oops). I really like it for cutting veggies and meat. It's my only knife and I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: Probably the most practical solution to your food-chopping needs.
customer_reviews.text: The steel in this knife has been uniquely formulated to remain relatively burr-free despite not having the rockwell hardness of fancier knives. Considering the my family and roommates are not competent chefs who know how to take care of knives properly, this is the best overall compromise between utility/durability/sharpness. Honing with a ceramic rod seems to work pretty well, although I haven't managed to get it hair-popping.
customer_reviews.author: Lash LaRue

customer_reviews.title: As a knife collector.....
customer_reviews.text: As a knife collector, I was not expecting much out of this knife for the price, but it has absolutely performed better than my expectations. I've had it for about six months and still haven't sharpened it, I've only had to hone it before use. The angle is a little weird to get used too, but like a lot people have said, after getting familiar with the knife, I feel like I could use it it all day. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyAndHusband

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest of the great chef knifes you'll find
customer_reviews.text: It's not cheap per se, but it's the least money you'll pay for a great chef knife. Comes sharp from factory, holds the edge, and is comfortable to hold. I bought it to use with "biohazard" foods like raw chicken, where I feel like hot soapy water won't be enough to keep the knife sanitary - this knife goes through the dishwasher (topmost flat cutlery rack, where it doesn't get banged up). After several months and many dishwasher cycles, it's still trucking, and I have a feeling it will serve me for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Dull knife 🔪
customer_reviews.text: I got the product but I am not happy with it. You would expect a brand new knife to be extremely sharp. It s not. Waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: Beata Krawczyk

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Deserving of 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: My family recently converted to Victorinox knives, and it's the best thing we ever did. They are cheap but also great quality, they are very sharp and when they become more dull, they sharpen very well with a proper knive sharpener. I was skeptical at first that SO many people gave these knives 5 stars, but they really are worthy and are a great purchase. One day I would like to have a beautiful, expensive, high quality knife set, but until then these Victorinox really are the next best thing!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Best knife ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my favorite knife! (And I have lots of expensive knives!). Well balanced, sharp, good size for anything you need to cut, particularly large cuts of meat. I use it every day, and it is easy to clean for the next use. It seems to be holding its edge too...I haven’t had to sharpen it yet! Best knife ever!
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Not very pretty, but performs great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this knife for a few months. I read some reviews online before selecting. Supposed to hold the edge long and be pretty easy to sharpen. I haven't had to sharpen the blade yet so I cannot say how easy it sharpens. It's well balanced when cutting and I find myself reaching for this knife instead of my old favorites. It's look is very utilitarian, but it out performs some of my more expensive knives. Excellent value for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Just Julie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knife, just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It came super fast, perfectly packed. I tried it out today and it really WORKS! It's super sharp, my hands are small but I had no trouble handling it and slicing a chicken breast and veggies with it. Great buy, strongly recommend. A bit pricey but hey, if you want quality you have to pay accordingly. Hope to continue using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nelida Kreer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Damn! It’s perfect! The knife is exactly as I remember the previous one from Victorinox I had a decade ago!! Comfy, sharp, easy to use and did I mention sharp? And for this price? I think I will get some for my kids to inherit. Btw, I cook every day and a lot. I cut fast and this is the one that makes me enjoy the job at hand. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: stewi

customer_reviews.title: Okay Knife not super impressed
customer_reviews.text: I mean... it’s a knife. I was a little disappointed by how well it cuts considering I read so many great reviews on the product and it wasn’t quite as sleek when cutting as I thought it would be. Other than that- easy to hold and can cut things so I suppose that’s all you really need
customer_reviews.author: Jade M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knife for a non-chef
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing to a Henckels knife set and a few cuisinart knives, but this one is much sharper. Cuts easily and cleans easily-- hasn't developed water spots like I've experienced with other knives. Chefs can probably tell a difference between this and more expensive knives, but its been a great go-to for day-to-day cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really liking the knife so far. I've got a bunch of different knives of varying quality but recently started preferring prefer chef knives over santokus and have been trying to get some better ones. I received anas a gift last year which is nice, especially with the skinny knife tip for doing things I'd normally get a paring knife dirty for but I do worry about long-term durability. The Victorinox can't do the detail work like that but I like the way it cuts for everything else and it was about 1/8 of the price so I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: j.kimble

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This knife was a recommendation from Chef Tila for a modest price chef knife. I have a knife I have used for 40 years . I wanted a second knife so I got this one. It is lighter and that is nice if I am doing a lot of cutting. The handle has a nice grip. The blade is quite sharp. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good knife!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this can't be beat. This is very! sharp right out of the box and maintains an edge well and sharpens easily. Yes the handle material may look cheap but it really is function over looks. The grip on this knife is second to none. While washing this with soapy hands I have tested it and it's still grips amazingly well. I have much more expensive knives and this one beats all of them. I keep it in a separate drawer to keep others from using it (lol) and it is my go-to knife for pretty much everything.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife! Easy to hold, lightweight, but cuts through veggies and meat like butter! So sharp, in fact, that when slicing little tomatoes I sliced the tip of my finger and didn't even realize it at first! (My finger is fine...nothing a little superglue didn't fix.) But seriously, I love this knife, and will be purchasing more from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Raichael

customer_reviews.title: America's test kitchen recommendation
customer_reviews.text: ATK recommended this chef's knife on their cooking equipment testing section on their web site and it has been a great knife. It holds it's edge quite well, it is easy to hold/grip with it's handle (even when you're hands are wet), and it has a nice balance in the hand. I would highly recommend this Knife to anyone that is looking for an affordable chef's knife under $40 that holds up to most of the more expensive knifes our there.
customer_reviews.author: Georgiee33

customer_reviews.title: Looks common, but cuts with regal quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the best knife purchase for the price. It isn't much to look at, but if you are more interested in blade performance than esthetics, do not pass on this knife. The handle material has a good grip, even if your hands are wet and slippery. It is lightweight, but heavy duty on cutting action. For home use it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Pam K.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for good performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a half a dozen of these both for myself and for gifting, to chefs no less! Came highly recommended by America’s test kitchen and you can see them in use on their videos. However, the price keeps going up, quite unnecessarily in my opinion. I guess that’s what popularity does for you. When it’s sharpened well it actually scares me, but according to my son the chef, if it cuts you at least it will be a clean-cut. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: NCFoodie

customer_reviews.title: Best knife I’ve ever owned-and best price too!
customer_reviews.text: Easily the sharpest knife I’ve ever owned—including compared to my $150 JA Henckels chef’s knife. I’ve used it everyday day for over six months and the blade is still very sharp. The thick handle is very comfortable too. It’s so affordable that I’ve bought one for my sister and mother so that I don’t have to use their dull knives when I’m at their houses for holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Jen and Will

customer_reviews.title: Really sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This knife is just amazing for the price. Before I saw this, I was contemplating buying a $50 Damascus knife. I am glad I changed my mind. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: concernedcatholic

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. I bought the knife based on the America’s Test Kitchen’s recommendation. It’s been seven days exactly since I’ve got the knife and it’s already dull. It cuts the same way as my other even cheaper knifes, which haven’t been sharpened in more than six months.
customer_reviews.author: Yervand Stepanyan

customer_reviews.title: Durable knife for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a chef knife since I started cooking a lot more. Its definitely a great choice for this price point. Its very durable and the grip makes it very easy to use! I love the product overall, Its definitely a great choice for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Steffi

customer_reviews.title: This knife if SHARP!!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw an outstanding rated review of this knife brand in a culinary magazine then I saw several hanging from a magnetic strip in my local butcher shop. Well that sold me! I went right home & placed my Amazon order for both the 8" & the 6". I fancy myself as quite a good home gourmet cook so I was looking for a sharp knife that retains it's edge with lots of use. This is that knife! I've used it for everything from peeling delicate tomatoes & peaches to cutting thru chicken bones prior to cooking. I am really picky with my kitchen items, these knives have a happy permanent place in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Wooliver

customer_reviews.title: Easy to feel over-confident. Don’t cut yourself.
customer_reviews.text: No sooner did I buy this knife than it was written up in People magazine. And it is an excellent knife, especially for the money. So sharp that I cut myself immediately.. Also good for tomatoes, which is my test for a sharp knife. Highly recommended by a non-cook.
customer_reviews.author: Ariadne Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for a low price. I just started getting into cooking and a good knife makes a big difference. Feels comfortable in your hand and is easy to use and cook with. Perfect chef knife for those who aren't ready to spend hundreds on a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Xander Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife! It not only holds an edge, but it holds like a master's knife should. From the tip to the end of the blade, I always feel like I'm in control. I quit using my Chinese vegetable knife for this one. I have never been disappointed in the quality of this company. Knives or watches...they deliver!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sharp, and not slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift ( i know i know its bad luck to buy a knife as a gift or so i have heard). I bought it as a gift for a chef I know and he was quite pleased with this knife. I also have it and think its one of the best knives in that price range by far. It cuts through vegetables with no effort and has a nice grippy feel to it even when wet. I would purchase another in a heartbeat if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Not fancy  - just a solid knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm a former chef - have had my victorinox for over 20 years. Yes, i have had higher end knives... this one is still my workhorse. I bought this one for my son, and he's learning how to cook
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, but not the best I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Fine knife, comfortable enough handle, pretty sharp. Not as sharp out of the box as Global knives, slightly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Cool knife
customer_reviews.text: My previous knives were old, dull, and chipped, so basically anything with an edge would be an improvement. This knife is nice and sharp. I can cut onions once more, but this time with only a minimal amount of suffering. The edge has stayed sharper for longer than the random knife I bought from my local grocery store, which isn't really a high bar to pass, but I'm pleased regardless. The knife does come with a dinky little plastic sleeve. I don't know how much blade guarding that offers, or if its even intended to do that.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: This knife means business!
customer_reviews.text: From the Swiss Army Knife manufacturers. I’m no chef, so when I realized the sharp effectiveness of this knife, I gained a new respect for my fingers. Keep em out the way! Not the knife to use if you’re easily distracted.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Great per, great value
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp knife. Always thought this was a cheap knife due to cost and appearance. The cost is great and the function is also great. Sold on the product and this hidden gem. Have Shuns and Global brand and this one is now my go to for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Labboss

customer_reviews.title: Good Feel on the Hand Knife
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy cheaper chef's knife so I decided to splurge a little and read good review on this Victorinox knife. I felt was very sharp out of the box but for me rather quickly the blade became dull. Bought the SunrisePro Supreme Knife Shapener and has regained its sharpness. Still too early but the knife handles well.
customer_reviews.author: RayRay

customer_reviews.title: Not the cheapest knife, but performs like more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.text: I always had heard that a sharp knife is actually safer than a dull knife, but just kept using my old one. I'd been looking at very expensive chef's knives, but kept seeing the Victorinox brand on the top 3 of most reviews. It's still not the cheapest you can buy, like the ones for $10-15, but it performs as I would expect for a knife 2 or 3 times as much. Some people may feel it's too big, but I find the handle and size to be just right. It has a nice weight to in, so I don't need to use that much force to slice soft things like tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: True

customer_reviews.title: You’ll want to chop stuff up all day!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby and I think I love it more than he does! Making chopping veggies and fruits a breeze and it stays sharp. I used to use smaller knives to cut but I’m a convert. This makes cutting up food easier and faster and I’ll never go back to my old ways of citing. Easy, comfortable grip too.
customer_reviews.author: sfry

customer_reviews.title: Truly an amazing knife. I am not a chef
customer_reviews.text: Truly an amazing knife. I am not a chef, but I do cook often and this is by far the best kitchen knife I've had. I did a lot of research before buying and in all reviews this was comparable to much more expensive knives. When it arrived, the first time I used it I knew I made a good choice. My girlfriend is heavy into the veggies and she likewise things it's amazing. Do yourself a favor. Go through the professional trade reviews. They'll confirm what I'm saying. You will not be disappointed in it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Gorall

customer_reviews.title: Great overall knife
customer_reviews.text: Just like “cook’s illustrated” says. Lightweight knife, very ergonomic grip. Blade has excellent “roll” when chopping. Sharpens quickly on my chef’s choice 130 and work sharp sharpenrs. Extremely versatile!!!
customer_reviews.author: denverteach

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical of this knife because it just always seemed inferior to my expensive Shun and Zwilling Henckels knives. But This knife pleasantly surprised me. It may not look as pretty as my other knives but easily stands up to them. It’s very sharp out of the box and is actually very easy to sharpen and hone. It’s also nice to have in the kitchen because if I need a good knife but also a knife that won’t make me upset if it breaks, I can reach for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: This is our first chef's knife that did not come from a knife block set. I love this knife a lot. It came out of the box sharp and ready to go. I love the width of it and the weight. I've cut everything from sashimi to veggies with it and have not been disappointed so far. It definitely works better than those block knives, and I feel like it was worth every penny. I'm not sure how it stacks up to other knives, but as a beginner to the knife world I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Victorinox
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. This blade makes short work of tough things to cut like raw yams. It's just an all around great chopping knife. You could spend $150 for a expensive chef's knife and not do any better. At least from the blades perspective. The handle is not anything special, it's just plastic, but it's adequate. Do your self a favor, spend $45 on this knife and $10 on their 4 inch pairing knife. If you've never had really good knives, once you've used these you'll kick yourself for not getting some sooner. I own Cutco knives and would put these far cheaper knives right up with them in performance.
customer_reviews.author: David Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: The knife is very sharp and comes with a think plastic cover. We bought this knife two years ago and used it so much that we bought another. It's the perfect size for my husband but a little too large for my hand which is why I gave it 4/5 stars. He would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works For Me
customer_reviews.text: This chef's knife is well-balanced, sharp and reasonably priced. While I do a lot of cooking I do not aspire to Iron Chefdom. I wanted a well-made, functional piece of cutlery that would serve me well for everyday needs. I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.  SchwartzTop Contributor: Philosophy

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable value in a knife
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best value in a chefs's knife. Razor sharp out of the box and takes a new edge well. The handle is reasonably comfortable and retains its grip even if your hands get a bit damp. It lacks the heft you expect of more expensive knives and I don't think I'd want this as my only chef's knife as I cook quite a bit, but if you are on a budget, are young and setting up your first kitchen, or need a spare, this is a great deal, especially if you grab it on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: One sharp knife
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Henkels knives for years, and they were never as sharp as this one. After over a month of daily use on plastic cutting boards, I have only needed to use the straightening steel on it. Though the handle looks cheap, it is the most comfortable home knife I have used and I find it much less slippery than more expensive knives. My only complaint is that I keep nicking my fingers because of the sloppy habits I've acquired from using a dull knife that I could never get really sharp. I'm planning to replace all my Henkels with VIctorinox.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D. Holm

customer_reviews.title: Cuts veggies, chicken, herbs, fingers...
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my mother after she visited and found no suitable knives in our drawer... It works great, cuts well, and hopefully we can keep it sharp! My husband already sliced his hand open using it. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The knife I got has a cheap feel to it. Blade looks thin. No idea how one could sharpen it. It was extremely sharp initially. but after a couple weeks of minimal use, is dull
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all purpose knife. I use it to cut everything except bread, it cuts bread just fine, but not like a serrated knife. I handwash only and place it vertically to dry. Only thing I don't love is how quickly it dulls. But with the frequency of use I guess that's to be expected. I'm just glad I have a sharpener. Definitely recommend this to the person on a budget who wants a good quality knife. You don't need a ton of knives! Just a couple really good ones and something to sharpen them with. Be careful when you first get it. It will be extremely sharp!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: excellent chefs knife, especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: your not getting a better chef knife for the money. I also own a wustoff classic equivalent (which I absolutely love using) and I can tell you the experience is the same if not a bit better once you get use to this blade. Americas test kitchen was dead on with this one. not just a best bang for the buck but truly an excellent product in its class
customer_reviews.author: Peter Zouboulakis

customer_reviews.title: What a difference
customer_reviews.text: We really love this knife. America's test kitchen gave it a glowing review that helped us to discover this knife. We purchased one and then added another after a year. Compared to the cheap knives we had been using, the difference is tremendous. I must confess I have had a Swiss army knife in my pocket since I was about 12 years old, so my objectivity might be compromised here. We run the knife through the fine wheel of our knife sharpener perhaps once per year. We should probably do this more often, but I'm lazy. I like to think we do a lot of chopping around our house. Of course your mileage many vary depending on your habits.
customer_reviews.author: Jared J. Johansen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife for a more than solid price! Cuts beautifully and exactly what you expect for this price of knife. Don’t go back to super cheap knives. If you’re cheap like me, go for this cheap but not super cheap and definitely better quality choice for your frequent cooking needs. Worth it
customer_reviews.author: Len901

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: I like a thin sharp knife for kitchen work and this is it. It comes sharp with a plastic edge guard. I've used it every day since it arrived two months ago and find no flaws. So far I haven't had to touch up the edge. I'd buy it again or as a gift for someone. I have purchased a few Victorinox Paring knives since getting to use this one. And I'm looking at a few other Victorinox knives as well . . . still shopping for my needs as yet though. So, the 8 inch Chef's knife is a great knife and won't break the bank. Grab one.
customer_reviews.author: JimL

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the sharpest knife that I have ever used. It cuts through vegs, meat, the chopping board and my finger like cutting through air. That being said, be careful when you use it and never put too much strength on your cut. It will break things that you don't intend to break.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

product_meta.title: Victorinox Fibrox Pro Knife, 8-Inch Chef's FFP, 8 Inch, Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:8-Inch Chef's (FFP Packaging)| Design:Chef's KnifeA TRUSTED FAVORITE
Preferred by both home chefs and culinary professionals, the 8" Fibrox Pro Chef's Knife can handle nearly every kitchen task imaginable. Crafted with a comfortable handle, superior weight and balance, and a razor sharp edge that rarely requires re-sharpening, this knife is an essential tool for every kitchen.

KEY FEATURES


 *  High-quality, lightweight European steel.
 *  Handle design reduces hand and wrist fatigue.
 *  Fit for dicing, mincing, chopping, slicing, and shredding. 
 *  Long, sloping curved blade that “rocks” for effortless mincing and chopping.
 *  Flat spine for extra power to slice through hard-skinned items.
 *  Non-slip patented Fibrox Pro handle for a secure and comfortable grip no matter the hand size. 
 *  National Sanitary Foundation (NSF) approved and dishwasher safe. 

CARE AND USE
Be good to your knives and they’ll be good to you. Following these simple guidelines will ensure that you get the longest life out of your knife! 

CLEANING
Victorinox Swiss Army recommends washing all knives by hand. For best results, hand wash your knives with a soapy cloth and dry immediately. 
While Fibrox Pro knives are dishwasher safe, we recommend hand washing as dishwashers are designed to spray water at a relatively high pressure, which can jostle the silverware and cause the knives to collide, dulling the edge.

SHARPENING
For optimum performance, knives should be honed after every couple of uses. Proper and frequent use of a honing steel will keep your knives sharper and performing at their best. 

FORMERLY FORSCHNER
In 1937 Victorinox began selling cutlery in America through a Connecticut distributor called R.H. Forschner & Co. A well-known manufacturer of butcher scales, Forschner soon became the exclusive U.S. distributor for Victorinox knives, and was the name by which Victorinox knives were known.
feature_bullets: For home chefs & professionals. This Fibro Pro chef's knife has been the top choice of both home chefs and professionals alike. Expertly crafted with a tapered stainless steel edge that cuts with ease and efficiency.

Fit for all tasks. Designed to handle kitchen tasks both big and small, This durable knife's razor sharp and laser-tested blade effortlessly chops, minces, slices and dices. An essential for every kitchen.
Easy handling. Each knife features an ergonomic handle made from thermoplastic Elastomer (TPE) for a non-slip grip -- even when wet. This exceptional knife is weighted and balanced for easy handling.
Knife Dimensions. Blade made out of stainless steel material -- 7. 9 inches in length. Made with dishwasher safe materials for an easy clean.
Trusted Swiss quality. Expertly crafted in Switzerland in 1884, Victorinox provides a lifetime against defects in material and workmanship. Making a Lifetime commitment has never been so easy.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars13,045 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
